text:
```What does it take to get an idea from a research concept into practice?

...

for the sake of other would-be tech transfer pioneers... the next time they show you the new button they helped get put into Visual Studio or the approach that two people in a back office of Google are using instead of lamely saying "that's great", try flipping out and doing cartwheels down the hall. 
They have been part of a real accomplishment that is good for all of us as researchers, helping our profession stay relevant. Tech transfer is NOT just an implementation detail.```
Also, scratch for industrial robots!

<https://twitter.com/davidcshepherd/status/1380582222093148163>

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/davidcshepherd|@davidcshepherd>: What does it take to get an idea from a research concept into practice? Well, it's funny you should ask...

Please enjoy this series of videos that illustrate ONE idea's journey from concept to product. This work was done by a TON of different people, working as a team.

What does it take to get an idea from a research concept into practice? Well, it's funny you should ask...

Please enjoy this series of videos that illustrate ONE idea's journey from concept to product. This work was done by a TON of different people, working as a team.

elements.text:
What does it take to get an idea from a research concept into practice?

...

for the sake of other would-be tech transfer pioneers... the next time they show you the new button they helped get put into Visual Studio or the approach that two people in a back office of Google are using instead of lamely saying "that's great", try flipping out and doing cartwheels down the hall. 
They have been part of a real accomplishment that is good for all of us as researchers, helping our profession stay relevant. Tech transfer is NOT just an implementation detail.
